website_summaries.verdict: Intended for owners of Philips Hue LED bulbs, these LightStrips, as frivolous as they are, succeed by opening up another connected lighting option.
pros: Philips Friends of Hue LightStrips give creative lighting and home automation enthusiasts a programmable, flexible decorative lighting accessory
cons: These tiny LEDs aren't as programmable out of the- box as they could be, which hurts given their high price tag

customer_reviews.title: Great accent lighting
customer_reviews.text: These Hue LEDs ("LEDs") are paired with a Gen 1 Hue hub. Using the "manual search" method, theLEDs were paired with the hub in seconds. These LED strips have a greater range of (realistic) colors than the Philips 65 W BR30 bulbs... of which we have scattered throughout our home. If I may, blues are blue, reds are red, greens are green, etc. with these LEDs. I'm hoping Prime Day will have these LEDs on sale... if so, I'm buying more!
customer_reviews.author: OCTrojan

customer_reviews.title: Change colors, concept is cool.
customer_reviews.text: These things are cool and they change colors with my second generation hub. Able to turn on and off from my phone when I'm not there. Going to use as holiday lights inside, around my window. Some days can be green and some red. Orange for Halloween. Red for Valentine's day...you get the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Chh

customer_reviews.title: Boy, you crazy!
customer_reviews.text: .....and the reviews are NUTS! This lightstrip works perfectly and are not dim. Make adjustments in your app people! By the way, they are not just white bulbs as said in the description. They can change to different colors just like the new ones. I use with my Google Home assistant. Over 6.5 feet of lights for nearly half the price. If you want something quick, get this!
customer_reviews.author: Vince!

customer_reviews.title: You need to buy two strips to cover the back of a 60inch TV.
customer_reviews.text: Don't understand the negative reviews I've had this product for months now which I use with my smart things hub and I love it... I installed the strip being my TV and it adds an excellent back light accent. TIP - You need to buy two strips to cover the back of a 60inch TV.
customer_reviews.author: Mark E

customer_reviews.title: Hue strip. Red light district
customer_reviews.text: Adhesive not the greatest. Other than that, excellent. *****Update***** I have 2 of these behind my tv. After Working great for months, one of the strips won't shut off and is always on, dim red. Can't turn it off. Tried unplugging it, yelling at it, having a heart to heart. Nothing. It still reacts when I turn it on and changes colors etc, but as soon as I turn it "off" it goes right back to the dim red. It's mounted on the back of a wall mounted tv, so I just leave it. Call it a night light I guess now.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel H.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Color Reproduction, But Bad Adhesive!
customer_reviews.text: I use Hue for photography and film work. Great light strip, gets better color reproduction than the actual bulbs (try having both show the perfect shade of blue.) Same goes with the Bloom. Unfortunately, the strip could use better adhesive, had to tinker to keep them up.
customer_reviews.author: P. Hodaee

customer_reviews.title: Nice sturdy lighting. Quick shipping!
customer_reviews.text: Love the concept of this product, but did not realize that a control base was also needed to purchase. I was looking for lights to go under the counter, and thought this was a great solution. The light strip itself is a sturdy product, and the cord would have allowed enough slack to run the lights either above or below my kitchen cabinets. I also liked that it could be controlled with a smart phone, however, since I did not purchase the base necessary to make it work, it went back.
customer_reviews.author: ScretSquirrl

customer_reviews.title: 4 Stars
customer_reviews.text: These lights are okay. I have both generation 2 and this generation light strip. The only difference between these and generation 2 lights is the brightness and the price. Generation 2 lights are much brighter and more expensive. I'm happy with this purchase. It saved me some money and works well with Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Myke Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise the colors are very beautiful and bright
customer_reviews.text: Wish they were longer or you could add more sets onto the end for such a high price point, also wish you could put it on rainbow or program to fade between certain colors you choose via the hue app, it does not make any sense that I have to buy a third party app to do those basic functions for the price these cost. Otherwise the colors are very beautiful and bright.
customer_reviews.author: S. Blades

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect it to be bright but the whites are not very bright at all. So far all that Alexa can do at the moment is turn it off and on haven't been able to change the color through Alexa. Update: 8/11/2017 Well Alexa is now controlling the color. Alexa change the TV light strip red and it obeys. Okay
customer_reviews.author: Barry J. Gervais

customer_reviews.title: decent
customer_reviews.text: I has bought a later version of these lights for a storage closet and they work great. I got this earlier model for my wife's closet. this strip is for more decorative settings, the light is decent, but it's just not that bright. I liked the long power cord, & since I'm all in with the Hue system, I wanted this to be used with my other philips lights/amazon echo in the room.
customer_reviews.author: J B Warren

customer_reviews.title: Phillips does it again!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nifty little set up. Sticks real well, holds colors close but not as good as the bulbs. Used it for my son's bunk bed so he could read at night and add some color to the rest of him room. Removing it I am sure will damage it if your careful so think real hard where you will wind up putting it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G

customer_reviews.title: Now this I like! I have it above my kitchen cabinets
customer_reviews.text: Now this I like! I have it above my kitchen cabinets, the color matches the tone of the wood cabinets. The light draws me right to the liquor cabinet in the dark :-). Seriously it adds a nice ambiance to a darkened room. and if you want to get crazy you can have it synce with a music source and change color along with the music beat. Pretty cool
customer_reviews.author: Joseph G.

customer_reviews.title: This thing can hit a nice solid green or blue
customer_reviews.text: The color of the light is much more accurate compared to most of the other hue bulbs I have. This thing can hit a nice solid green or blue, etc. and is a great accent in a lot of places in my home. Thought it was a rip compared to the price of the bulbs but it actually provides much more ambience for the money compared to the bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 10/5 starts for Phillips Hue
customer_reviews.text: Philips Hue lights have to be my favorite thing ever. I started with just these and Now I have two lightstrips, 2 accent lights, 3 of the B-something bulbs and 3 of the A-something bulbs. Note: The new lightships are probably 2x as bright as these which is nice for helping to light up a room. This is more for accents under the counter and such.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Weinstein

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I use these as an accent light under my kitchen island. They're beautiful! They are perfect with the other Philips Hue lights I have and work well with the scenes that I've already created. (Just edit the scene and add the new light to it.) Since these LEDs are true RGB, they are capable to deep blues and greens that regular Hue bulbs struggle with. I use IFTTT to have these lights automatically turn on around sundown. Super cool. I couldn't recommend them enough. Philips is doing an awesome job with the entire line of Hue products.
customer_reviews.author: apg

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lightstrips I while back, and so far they’re pretty good. They were quite a bit cheaper than the newer version. The brightness is decent, but not great. The colors are pretty good, and they’re responsive. Overall they’re pretty good, but could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob S.

customer_reviews.title: These strips are great. I love my hue lighting system and strips
customer_reviews.text: These strips are great. I love my hue lighting system and strips.Hard to round corners with them and sometimes the adhesive wears off, especially if it gets hot from external sources.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Here come the Jetsons (reprise)
customer_reviews.text: Fun stuff. I was going "home automation" back in 1979 when X10 first came out. This makes the implementation much easier. I'm using this for a low-light, color-enhanced back light for my home theater HDTV. Combined with the LED light starter kit and the Amazon Echo, you're on your way to the future.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Great colors and function
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as an addition to my hue lights that I have throughout my place. Compared to the other bulbs, these produce a wider range of bright colors. The only area they lack is in the area of white light, where the light appears dim. This is definitely not much of a negative though, as these are intended for accent lighting, and produce amazing bright colors.
customer_reviews.author: Vreenak

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected, thought it was 2nd generation ...
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected, thought it was 2nd generation. I can not expand so will be getting rid of and going with another brand for this price
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Its installed along the back of my TV as a back light. It's a perfect accent light source.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Q.

customer_reviews.title: Great lights!
customer_reviews.text: Love these lights! They work exactly as described and easy to set up with existing hub. I put these on a stairway leading upstairs along with a motion detector so that it lights up at night or in morning when dark. Work great and love the color changing options.
customer_reviews.author: Ted C Lisby

customer_reviews.title: Warning! Gen 1, Not so bright
customer_reviews.text: Much dimmer than the newer generation. I didn't notice it was Gen 1 but the price was so good I bought two. If brightness is not concern like behind a TV or under bed, this is great. I wanted it for a 55 gallon fish tank. I had to buy a Gen2.
customer_reviews.author: ThatSolarGuydotCom

customer_reviews.title: Hue Strip Lights are Fun and Easy to Install!
customer_reviews.text: The headline really says it all. My only complaint is that Philips doesn't make more Hue products! ...yet. What will be great is when Amazon Echo allows you to control color schemes in addition to the present ability of turning these lights on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Bronson Picket

customer_reviews.title: Nice lights, working fine
customer_reviews.text: Nice lights, working fine. Be aware that these are not the "plus" lights, which are expandable and brighter. These are great as color accent lights, but they're not going to light up your room or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Darby Schaaf

customer_reviews.title: like a boss!
customer_reviews.text: I love Philips Hue products. My house is pimped it with them. It's very pricey, but I love the colors and controls and ease of use/setup. I don't like there being only one sticky use to them. If I need to move them I'm worried it's going to be problematic. Should come with mounts/hooks for the price
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great prices sometimes since these 1st generations are often on clearance... check Amazon Warehouse Deals
customer_reviews.text: While it doesn't have the possibility of extending it like the 2nd generation model has (the), this 1st generation light strip is now a great buy when you can grab it at clearance prices below $45. The lights are just as fun as the rest of the Hue line but much more flexible because you can put the light strip just about anywhere with its sticky backing. Compare prices with the starter pack that includes two lightstrips... sometimes the two-pack is cheaper per strip than this single strip. Pick them up now on clearance before the 1st generation ones are out of stock everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Juniorverse

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pricy but works as described, however you have to have their hub as well.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Wants and Needs
customer_reviews.text: It's overpriced, no getting around it. If you're the type of person that spends $199.95 for three light-bulbs, you don't care about things being overpriced. If you want to see in the dark, buy a flashlight. If you want to light a room, get the lightstrip.
customer_reviews.author: JPR

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I wish it turned corners better but it works great
customer_reviews.author: Mark M. Lavallee

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best lighting system. A must have for bar, bedroom, save your candle. LOL.
customer_reviews.author: AmyNick

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are the best. Put above kitchen cabinets and under coffee table
customer_reviews.author: A Esposito

customer_reviews.title: Not happy this is the old style
customer_reviews.text: Not happy this is the old style. Started to hookup and connect my extensions and found out that I can't. Beware that this will not work if you buy extensions.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: when this one works perfectly fine. Great product Phillips
customer_reviews.text: why buy the new model, when this one works perfectly fine. Great product Phillips!
customer_reviews.author: Amazonocholic

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great. Just doesn't work with Light recipes though just getting close enough would be fine with me.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not work with some HUE apps.... Color not bright bright...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cool concept, poor product
customer_reviews.text: These lights are very dim compared to the various $25 kits you can buy on Amazon that come with a remote control. Having the smart app makes these nice but the quality of the lighting gets them 2 stars. Especially at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!!
customer_reviews.text: Adhesive is strong, but it has it's limits. Don't expect it to hold if you're not supporting the power source part of the cable somehow. Other than that....AWESOME!!!
customer_reviews.author: Philip C

customer_reviews.title: Genius idea
customer_reviews.text: Self adhesive strip is great. It can only do colors, so it can't match the white color temp of the hue bulbs but it gets close. I am using it in a headboard of a bed. Looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Amaizing Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great addition to my collection of Hue lights
customer_reviews.text: A great addition to my collection of Hue lights. I put this one under the top cabinet in the kitchen to brighten up the counter (when needed) or add some color when showing off.
customer_reviews.author: Former CDN

customer_reviews.title: Not very bright and the color range is limited. ...
customer_reviews.text: Not very bright and the color range is limited. Works ok as an accent in our bedroom but I would not buy another.
customer_reviews.author: DM - Blue

customer_reviews.title: But they do a great job of copying standard bulb color temperatures
customer_reviews.text: Hue lamps don't do green. But they do a great job of copying standard bulb color temperatures. Green isn't a hard thing to do though. Jeez.
customer_reviews.author: P. Grace

customer_reviews.title: These lights are awsome
customer_reviews.text: These lights are fantastic! I am thinking of using them through out my house as accent lighting. It was super easy to install and all the lights work just fine. The adhesive strip is 3M so you know it will stick where you put it. This was my first purchase of a strip light, sort of a trial run . I wish they were a bit less expensive so I could convert my house all at once instead of fitting it in my budget where I can.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Lemon

customer_reviews.title: Great product! If you don't need to extend the ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product! If you don't need to extend the leds I recommend the gen 1 for the price!!!
customer_reviews.author: D.P.

customer_reviews.title: Just fun
customer_reviews.text: Great fun to make a home feel customized. Enjoyed setting schedules and making a home feel warm and techy.
customer_reviews.author: stuart

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love these - they look beautiful in my space and are fun to p;ay with too.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Fulkerson

customer_reviews.title: Works great! we put them behind the TV
customer_reviews.text: Works great! we put them behind the TV. Pairs well with other HUE products.
customer_reviews.author: J. West

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: I have waited a long time to add these to my Hue setup. I'm still not sure what to do with them. I wanted to use them under my cabinets where i currently have 3 halogens pucks. These are not even close to the same brightness, even when I double up the strand. They don't make a good white (soft, warm or other). I'm disappointed and trying to figure out what to do with a 6' strand of fun LED's that don't have much purpose.
customer_reviews.author: S. Blumenschein

customer_reviews.title: Additional Products Needed to Make it Work!!!
customer_reviews.text: Read Carefully, you need a $60 Bridge or Alexa to make these work. In my haste, I overlooked that when ordering! So, it's not Phillips fault, it's my fault.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but is pretty expensive for what it does
customer_reviews.text: It has a coolness factor with the changing of colors, but is pretty expensive for what it does. Would be willing to pay the price if you could link strands together, if it did some other stuff like chasing and twinkling or blinking. or if you could somehow change every other LED. Make it look more like holiday lights, Also if you could use them outside. The instructions say they would be good for under cabinets, and they might if there was a way to link multiple strands as they are now you would need to have a plug under each cabinet you wanted to illuminate.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THEM
customer_reviews.text: VERY NICE LED LIGHT, I HAVE THESE ALL OVER MY HOME.
customer_reviews.author: Batman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Have them in a Tray enclosure in the kitchen, what a light show it produces.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very beautiful item, but price has to come down before any more purchases
customer_reviews.author: M.P.E.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love these lights! So many different apps to use these!
customer_reviews.author: J Cosgrove

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This looks beyond cool in my living room! LOVE IT
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Stenhouse Wells

customer_reviews.title: Bright and Great!
customer_reviews.text: I put this light strip on top of my cabinets in my kitchen, replacing a Hue Bloom spotlight (which I moved to another room). The light strip is bright and looks great, and can easily be moved if I decide to place it somewhere else. It's also very well constructed, the LEDs are embedded in a thick gel strip, which I liked, so I was never worried about breaking or damaging the strip!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Dore

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love the Philips lighting system and would highly recommend it. Great flexibility with creating different moods with light.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: pretty cool, really just need the driver that connects ...
customer_reviews.text: pretty cool, really just need the driver that connects to Hue, so I can use any rgb tape with it and control with phone.
customer_reviews.author: paul winegarner

customer_reviews.title: Hue-ge value!
customer_reviews.text: Colors are great, installation easy. Requires Hue bridge but once hooked up, it's wonderful. Efficient, pleasant light.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Phillips Products Work Marvelously with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: Really like these, I have them under my kitchen cabinets. It's like a voice activated night light when you integrate with the Amazon Echo. Be warned, once you start buying these you'll want to do the whole house and it'll get very expensive, but omg it's worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Casey L.

customer_reviews.title: A little dim
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product which is simple to install. The tape backing makes mounting a breeze, and shortening the length of the strip is super easy with just a pair of scissors. These strips are not super bright. I consider them great for accent lighting, but a little dim for task lighting (such as under cabinet lighting).
customer_reviews.author: macisboss

customer_reviews.title: Pleased, does what it should. Low level light
customer_reviews.text: A nice add on for home automation for ambience. They are not bright enough to read by, but as ambient background lights for TV watching they are quite nice. Setup was trivial if you already have you Hue bridge working. Works fine with Alexa/Echo/Dot
customer_reviews.author: Pongo

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect, works flawlessly with my iPad app
customer_reviews.text: Almost perfect, works flawlessly with my iPad app but the iPhone app has trouble adjusting the color so u can never get that nice warm yellow normal light u get a colored light or the "white light"
customer_reviews.author: Julien

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not as good as the Philips one.
customer_reviews.text: Work great. Not the brightest and they don't have the white LED... so I think the real Philips ones are a better deal. They work fine for behind myou TV though and connected to my existing hue system with no issue
customer_reviews.author: BrockintheBox

customer_reviews.title: Good piece of gear
customer_reviews.text: Good piece of gear. Works great and good value. There is an adhesive but one thing I will advise if you're using a staple gun to secure (I set mine atop my kitchen cabinets) don't penetrate the strip as it will cause defect in the light.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Chaffin, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Fun color choices
customer_reviews.text: Adds a festive touch to the lighting in my kitchen. Using on top of a cabinet. Have linked the Hue Bridge with my Wink Hub. Works well! Photo is a closeup of a sign backlit by the LED strip. Fun color choices. Would like a setting for random color changes at intervals.
customer_reviews.author: G O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: Read the specs carefully
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you clean the space thoroughly; otherwise the 3M tape will not stick, which will cause the strip to sag and dangle. Also would of been nice to know this version only produces white light.
customer_reviews.author: Zay

customer_reviews.title: these are great little light strips and hook into my Hue network ...
customer_reviews.text: these are great little light strips and hook into my Hue network perfectly. I'd give them 5 stars but for the price.
customer_reviews.author: T2

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product, Not something anyone needs but its fun to have.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff T. Keeven

customer_reviews.title: DISCONTINUED PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS IF YOU WANT TO EXTEND THE LIGHTS!!! No where is it stated that this is the OLD DISCONTINUED version of the light strip and you can not buy 1 m extensions, as shown on the Hue web site. There is a new version for the same price. Other sites are discounting this older version. The product itself works fine, but why pay the same price for the older discontinued model. I would have returned this but I had already placed the lights, assuming all I had to do was plug in the extension.
customer_reviews.author: G.B.Vogelsang

customer_reviews.title: Another Great Hue product
customer_reviews.text: Great concept - The lighting is great and it provides the effect, I was looking to achieve. The adhesive strip, is a little temperamental and 2 of the 4, I purchased separated during the unpacking process. I wish there was a way to connect more than one together out of the box, without a 3rd party product (but I knew this before making the purchase). Maybe on the next generation Philips will add that option.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dunstan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love how these strips accent areas and their compatibility with Echo
customer_reviews.author: Barry Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Work well with my main bridge and lights. No trouble connecting it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bernoski

customer_reviews.title: I would have given a five star, but I ...
customer_reviews.text: I would have given a five star, but I didn't realize I needed to buy a hub to use each light string.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Gaspar

customer_reviews.title: great product!
customer_reviews.text: set it up around my TV. Love these Philips Hue lights.
customer_reviews.author: tc

customer_reviews.title: Made me best brother!
customer_reviews.text: gave as a gift. very well received! My brother said it was very easy to pair with his other hue devices and apps. The only hard part, where to put it?
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Great home decor above my cabinets. Complements my other Hue lights well.
customer_reviews.author: Von Myart

customer_reviews.title: Would be better to get 2nd gen
customer_reviews.text: For the price it did what i needed it to do. Would be better to get 2nd gen !
customer_reviews.author: DDK

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to Phillips lighting system.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the Hue lighting system and this is a great addition to add highlights.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Candela

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome seller!!! Quick shipping. Item was just as described. A+++++
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Parker

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: The Philips 259982 Friends of Hue Personal Wireless Lightstrip is awesome. It is made of high quality and works great with the hub. I have it running along the top rear of the entertainment center and illuminates the wall and ceiling very nicely. I highly recommend all the Philips Hue products. They are a bit pricey but I love them and work great with the apps.
customer_reviews.author: acsgj

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy install under cabinets, look really good as accent lights
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not link with extension strips
customer_reviews.text: This system does NOT have extension strips! Don't be fooled that it can link with the System 2!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Balzac

customer_reviews.title: Hub required for control
customer_reviews.text: Didn't realize it couldn't be controlled without a hub so returned it
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B.

customer_reviews.title: Millions of colors... EXCEPT WHITE
customer_reviews.text: Millions of colors... EXCEPT WHITE!! The cheap ones from Ikea are so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Blankenship

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORTH THE TIME OR ENERGY.
customer_reviews.text: I would think that spending the money I did it would work. I did everything that I was supposed to do, but only half of the strip works, and the half that works only responds to half the light changes. NOT WORTH THE TIME OR ENERGY.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher R. Bickens

customer_reviews.title: Own three of these.  Two work flawlessly, third is a turd.
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these lights after about 60 days it started flickering and wouldn't hold the color. Since I'm outside the 60day return period for Amazon, I'm stuggling to get a replacement under warranty from Philips. I own two other of these light strips and they have had no issues. But I'm rating this particular purchase as the light doesn't perform as design and having issue getting a replacement. If something changes, I'll update the review. Maybe amazon will see this and help me out.
customer_reviews.author: Dave from Texas

customer_reviews.title: Needs Phillips Bridge to work
customer_reviews.text: My own fault I suppose. This does not work without the Phillips Bridge. I already have the Samsung Smartthings Hub. I sent it back as I didn't want to make another purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna Stewart

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: they don't give off a lot of light, not worth the money
customer_reviews.author: michael cleeman

customer_reviews.title: not for the budget buyer
customer_reviews.text: expensive you need the hue hub (100 bucks more) to make them work im sure they are awesome but not for the price
customer_reviews.author: Ryan N. Cox

product_meta.title: Philips Hue 1st Generation LightStrip Dimmable LED Smart Light (Older Model, Requires Hue Hub, Works with Alexa, Apple HomeKit, and Google Assistant)
product_meta.description: The Philips Hue LightStrip is the most flexible light source imaginable. Transform your living room, bedroom, kitchen and other rooms with millions of colors and shades of white light. Sync to games, music, and movies for enhanced experiences. Connect it to a Hue Bridge (sold separately) to control your lighting. Light the entire home with versatile accessories (sold separately) such as Hue Dimmer Switch, Hue Tap, or Hue Motion Sensor. Install the flexible LightStrip under bars, bed frames, or cabinets, with included adhesive tape. Trim it to the perfect size with the included cut marks. Extend your Lightstrip up to 32 feet by adding the Philips Hue LightStrip Plus Extension. Use the additional 40 inch extensions to cover larger surfaces and enable wider applications. Control via voice with Alexa, Apple HomeKit, and Google Assistant. Pair it with Nest or Samsung SmartThings. This box includes an 80 inch LightStrip, power adapter, manual, and two year warranty.
